title: Monoline Script Fonts?
content:
I'm looking for some monoline geometric script fonts similar to the samples shown below. I imagine some of these are custom, but I recall seeing some fonts like these in the past.

Thanks a mil for any recommendations.

Jim

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mono_samples_3456.jpg)
author: jimsbee

comments.content:
[http://www.sudtipos.com/fonts/50](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/50 "http://www.sudtipos.com/fonts/50")

also handsome pro is pretty nice.

I posted this same question here awhile ago. I think most of what you are showing here is custom. A nice contemporary monoline script is needed in my opinion.
More [monolinear scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/casual_monolinear_script/), though maybe not all the style you're looking for.

You could probably find something similar to "liquid," [Terital](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928/http:/www.letterbox.net.au/research/res_fo_terital.html) is close, and the type used for "branding" looks similar to [Orion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/orion-md/). But the two on the right are really unique. Closest I can think of is [Chamber Sans Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321004928/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_chambers_sans_ot/) with ligatures, you might get close.
